prompt.promptString: The Glamorous Toolkit Book consists of numerous notebook pages documenting various aspects of Moldable Development and the Glamorous Toolkit (GT) IDE that supports it.We are interested in categorizing the pages according to the kind of information they contain.Here is an incomplete list of some of the categories:Introduction: a page that introduces a topicVideo: a page pointing the reader to an on-line video for a given topicCase study: a page describing an existing case study that illustrates a topicTutorial: a page containing a step-by-step series of explanations and exercises to teach the reader about a topicFAQ: a page containing a "how to" question related to a topic, with a detailed answer to just that questionDefinition: a page whose title is a term and whose contents consists of a concise definition of that termTag: a page with a single word title identifying a topic and little or no contents, to be used as a tag in other pages on that topicThese are some of the most important categories, but there may be others as well.Your task is to assign a category to a page provided as input. A single answer is preferred, but in case of doubt, please propose two or even three alternatives. Also one of the categories listed above is preferred as an answer, but if none of those is a good fit, please propose a new category as one of the answers.In your answers, simply provide the category without any further explanation.Below follows a series of examples of User inputs consisting of notebook page contents, and the expected Assistant category as an answer.

examples.pageName: A gentle introduction to Pharo Smalltalk
How do I recover my work after a crash?
Working with a REST API: the GitHub case study

chats.pageName: A short history of Glamorous Toolkit
Editing Rust sources through the Language Server Protocol
How do I recover my work after a crash?
How to programatically register a new database to a logical database
Working with the OpenAI API client
